at.htl.geometrics

Class Line

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.htl.geometrics.Line

  • public class Line
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represent a line by storing two points and the length of the line.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jakob Ecker, Domink Simon

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Line()
      Constructs a new empty Line-Object.
      Line(at.htl.geometrics.Point point1, at.htl.geometrics.Point point2)
      Constructs a new Line-Object from two points and calculates the distance between them.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      at.htl.geometrics.CartesianVector getCartesianVector()
      Returns the vector in cartesian form that represents the line.
      double getLength()
      Returns the length of the Line.
      at.htl.geometrics.Point getPoint1()
      Returns the first Point of the Line.
      at.htl.geometrics.Point getPoint2()
      Returns the second Point of the Line.
      static at.htl.geometrics.Point getPointOfIntersectionLine(Line line1, Line line2)
      Calculates the Point of intersection of two lines.
      at.htl.geometrics.PolarVector getPolarVektor()
      Returns the vector in polar form that represents the line.
      void setPoint1(at.htl.geometrics.Point point1)
      Sets the first Point of the Line.
      void setPoint2(at.htl.geometrics.Point point2)
      Sets the second Point of the Line.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Custom toString that returns a formatted Line.
